Posts.EditableText:
So what other games do you all play?  And what systems?  PC, XBox 360, PS3, Wii, etc. etc....

Lately, I have been playing Left 4 Dead on XBOX 360 at my friend's house during lunchbreaks.  That is one crazy adrenaline packed game.  I play lots o' others too in my spare time (spare time - hahahaha)
Portal was lots of fun.  Very challenging.
I like all the adventure games from the old King's Quest games to the latest Nancy Drew craze.  Don't laugh.  They are fun and not just for girls.  I do play them with my wife though.
That's enough for now.... so what's new with you?

Posts.EditableText: I only have a spare few games for my Xbox 360, including: [*]SpiderMan 3 [*]Command & Conquer 3: Kane's Wrath [*]Kung-Fu Panda [*]Lego Indiana Jones [*]Fable 2 I am also a Call of Duty 4-5 addict, but don't own them. Same with Halo 3 and Gears of War 2. For computer I like to play: [*]Silkroad Online [*]Soldier Front As you can see I like my FPS and MMORPG's. --- Left 4 Dead is a great fun game, but quiet frankly, as with all zombie games in the 6th generation, it dissapointed me. I want a nice game where you run about with your friends, build baracades, find your own weapons, etc. Left 4 Dead lacks a big weapon choice, which screws around with me. I love the special infected, expecially throwing a molotov at a witch then shutting the door

---

Left 4 Dead is a great fun game, but quiet frankly, as with all zombie games in the 6th generation, it dissapointed me. I want a nice game where you run about with your friends, build baracades, find your own weapons, etc. Left 4 Dead lacks a big weapon choice, which screws around with me. I love the special infected, expecially throwing a molotov at a witch then shutting the door

Posts.EditableText:
Ah, you have played Left 4 Dead, Thana.  Nice.  The other day my friend said "I see her" and threw a cocktail and hit her in the head.  She came charging us (on fire) and we were in a building looking out and she couldn't jump up so we just kept shooting her until she died.  That was the luckiest encounter with a witch on that game so far.  Right now, we've been trying to beat the finale at the airport (level 4) on advanced instead of normal and we just can't seem to do it.  I really like the split screen left/right to play with a friend.  I agree that the lack of weapons is sad.

I have played C&C 3 on PC.  I just played the demo of Red Alert 3 and thing is awesome (on PC).  I have played through Kung Fu Panda on Wii and it was pretty cool.
My friend has Fallout 3 for the 360 but I haven't played it.  He seemed to like it though.

Posts.EditableText:
Easy Steve. There should be a nifty truck you can jump on, just sit there with an Auto Shotgun and blast any undead that try to hop on. If a tank comes along, just wait until he gets on, hop off, and backpedal until you kill him.

You wouldn't believe how many attempts I have had at trying to kill witches with a single headshot (because they don't take damage from the first shot they take whilst crying). I consider myself sort of a Witch Hunter.

Well hey, we did finally beat that level.  Tank?  How about TankS plural.  We were playing on advanced.  There was a broken down plane near the gas pump that we climbed up on the wing and fought off the horde... and the first Tank. Just started playing Resident Evil 5 at my friends house on Friday.  Yep, set Left 4 Dead aside and hunkered down into a new zombie game.  We've been waiting for this ever since I played through Resident Evil 4 (multiple times).

Posts.EditableText:
I've only played RE4 once.... Partly cos I got the Gamecube version  and unhooked it after I did it.. Partly because I couldn't be arsed to play it again.

.. I may play it again though, seeing as how I will need a refresher before RE5.

Is the story able to draw you in enough at the start?

I thought there would be WAY too many 'zombies' in it (even though they're not zombies anymore).

... It's pointless having THAT many fast and intelligent zombies with no real way to defend yourself... Which I guess is another reason I haven't played through RE4 - the sheer memory of having to be more careful with everything (actually I may have cheated using a cheat device halfway through - I'm not sure).

Posts.EditableText: RE5 is the epitome of clunky controls. I mean, come ON! "Oh no, a zombie is behind me with a broken bottle, I'll just turn around and shoot him. ... ... ... Oh crap, he hit me! If only I could turn around faster!" "Oh look, a corner! Too bad I'm too retarded to run around it, I have to run to it, stop, turn, then keep running! Good thing I don't have any pressure on me, it would be a bitch if Albert Whesker was chasing me right now!"
Posts.HTML:
RE5 is the epitome of clunky controls. I mean, come ON! "Oh no, a zombie is behind me with a broken bottle, I'll just turn around and shoot him.

...

...

...

Oh crap, he hit me! If only I could turn around faster!"

"Oh look, a corner! Too bad I'm too retarded to run around it, I have to run to it, stop, turn, then keep running! Good thing I don't have any pressure on me, it would be a bitch if Albert Whesker was chasing me right now!"

Posts.EditableText: Poor thani... If you're playing Xbox, try pressing down and A to do the quick turn-around. As for turning corners, welcome to the legacy of Resident Evil. On the Wesker, I just kept running... don't stop in the back hallways. Just run like a little girl. Wesker will eventually realize that he doesn't want to kill a little girl and he'll leave. Here's what sucks though... We played through the whole game... We unlocked all the Mercenary levels and unlocked a few of the characters and then my friend's Xbox gets the Red Ring of Death and has to exchange the Xbox for a new one. [CLICK] Start Again. All saved games for every game we've ever played is gone. Oh well... One more note, Thana-banana, they screwed up in designing the multiplayer where after you've signed in the player one control, there's no option to sign in to multiplayer (even if you signed in the second controller before turning on the game).... so, you have to go all the way into the game single player, then once the game starts, the second player hits start and he has to sign in but alas, it takes you back to the intro screen of the game and you have to go all the way back into the game again. It was lame.
Posts.HTML:
Poor thani...
If you're playing Xbox, try pressing down and A to do the quick turn-around. As for turning corners, welcome to the legacy of Resident Evil. On the Wesker, I just kept running... don't stop in the back hallways. Just run like a little girl. Wesker will eventually realize that he doesn't want to kill a little girl and he'll leave.

Here's what sucks though... We played through the whole game... We unlocked all the Mercenary levels and unlocked a few of the characters and then my friend's Xbox gets the Red Ring of Death and has to exchange the Xbox for a new one. [CLICK] Start Again. All saved games for every game we've ever played is gone.

Oh well...

One more note, Thana-banana, they screwed up in designing the multiplayer where after you've signed in the player one control, there's no option to sign in to multiplayer (even if you signed in the second controller before turning on the game).... so, you have to go all the way into the game single player, then once the game starts, the second player hits start and he has to sign in but alas, it takes you back to the intro screen of the game and you have to go all the way back into the game again. It was lame.
